intro: Perama parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered perama, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, often with a glossy surface. Perama parviflora is typically found in coastal regions and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
